content.description: Sit start underneath the overhang. Left hand on a long, horizontal crimp rail and right hand pinch on low arete. Kneebar on the supporting boulder and work right to the arete. The crux is finding a way to release from a wide wingspan. Top out is fairly easy. Landing is kind of sketchy but the hardest part of the problem is over by the time you get to that point.
content.location: This is the only problem on the boulder but a direct line could still be done without the use of the supporting boulder. Would go quite a bit harder.Â

content.description: This boulder is tucked in between sections of the cliff and is just off the Bur Oak Trail. The area is shaded and well protected by tree cover.
